answers.answer: Dear bcoz,Usually one undergoes laser vision correction due to a refractive error such as nearsightedness of the eye.  Nearsighted individuals are at an increased risk for retinal detachments.Dr. FeldmanSandy T. Feldman, M.D., M.S.ClearView Eye and Laser Medical CenterSan Diego, California

I was nearsighted before my Lasek surgery. My real name is Marlon M Padiernos. I live here in San Diego, California. Can you write me a letter  about my question is for veteran or maybe I get an appointment.

question: I don't have diabetes, no head injuries and no incindent on both eyes. When I was in the US Navy I had prk lasek surgery on both eyes. After 4 years, suddenly my right have detached retina. My doctor had made treatment on my right eye to have vitrectomy surgery. I still having problem my vision is blurring and cloudy. Is this likely or most likely related to lasek surgery? Note: I have a website for detached retina due to lasek surgery.
title: Is lasik surgery related to detached my retina?
